description:
Price index for prefabricated one-family houses without
cellar

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
61261 Price indices for the construction industry

Definition:
The price index shows the price movement for prefabricated
single-family houses. "Prefabricated" describes a
construction method where the load-bearing structure of a
building mostly consists of parts produced off-site -
especially entire walls and ceilings. These are
factory-built, brought to the construction site and put
together to form a building in a relatively short time.
The price index is determined as part of the statistics of
producer prices of industrial products. The prices are
collected from producers of prefabricated houses.


© Statistisches Bundesamt, Wiesbaden 2016
name: Price index prefab. one-fam. houses without cellar
